title: For this St. Lucian runner, the Boston Marathon is ‘nothing short of a dream’
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Ava Fevrier is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the Lingzi Foundation, aiming to be the first St. Lucian woman to earn a six-star finish.
Fevrier, 42, began road running seriously in 2022 after a break, working towards completing the six world marathon majors by 2026.
Fevrier holds the St. Lucian female national record in the marathon and is inspired by the foundation's message "Dream, Imagine."

title: Actor Henry Winkler named Emerson Collegeâ€™s 2026 commencement speaker
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Henry Winkler, Emerson College alumnus, will speak at the 2026 commencement on May 9 at Boston's Wang Theatre.
Winkler, known for 'Happy Days' and 'Barry,' is also an advocate for children with learning differences like dyslexia.
Approximately 1,000 undergraduate students will graduate during the ceremony, which will be streamed live at emerson.edu/live.

title: Score 20% off JetBlue flights to 3 destinations from Boston with Squares4Fares
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: JetBlue offers 20% off one-way flights from Boston to select destinations with Squares4Fares through February 10.
Discounted routes include Boston to Fort Lauderdale, Daytona Beach, and Phoenix; Boseman to Boston is also included.
Tickets must be booked by February 10 for travel through March 18, excluding Fridays and Sundays.

title: State Police academy supervisor and 3 instructors charged with manslaughter in death of recruit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts State Police supervisor and three instructors face manslaughter charges in the 2024 death of recruit Enrique Delgado-Garcia.
Delgado-Garcia died following injuries from unsupervised boxing exercises at the State Police training academy, a grand jury found.
Sgt. Jennifer Penton faces additional perjury charges; defensive tactics training at the academy has since been suspended.

title: OpenTable names 2 Massachusetts restaurants among the most romantic in the U.S.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: OpenTable's 2026 list includes Sorellina in Boston and Pellana Steakhouse in Peabody as romantic dining spots.
Sorellina offers Italian-Mediterranean dishes with seafood and pasta in a formal Back Bay setting.
Pellana Steakhouse specializes in prime beef and seafood with a rich menu on the North Shore.

title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks for February 2026
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix adds 'Ex Machina,' 'Hell or High Water,' and 'You've Got Mail' to its February lineup.
The Boston.com Queue highlights Catherine O'Hara's performances in 'A Mighty Wind,' 'Home Alone,' and 'Schitt's Creek'.
Staff picks include 'The Pitt' Season 2 on HBO, 'People You Meet on Vacation' on Netflix, and 'Secret Mall Apartment' on HBO.

title: What the Patriots need to do in the off-season, according to readers
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston.com readers overwhelmingly suggest improving the New England Patriots' offensive line after their Super Bowl LX defeat.
79% of readers expected the Patriots' loss, citing offensive line struggles as a key factor in the outcome.
Suggestions also include acquiring a top wide receiver and bolstering both offensive and defensive lines for offseason strategy.

title: Springfield dry sausage plant to close, cutting 190 jobs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Smithfield Foods will close its Springfield, Massachusetts plant by August, eliminating 190 jobs and ending local production.
The Springfield facility's work will be shifted to other Smithfield plants, with employee transition support offered.
Smithfield previously settled with the EPA over Clean Air Act violations and confirmed the closure is unrelated to the settlement.

title: What Stefon Diggs said about his Patriots future
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs plans to remain with the Patriots, although he acknowledges the decision isn't entirely his.
Diggs signed a three-year, $69 million contract last offseason and is under contract through 2027.
Diggs is facing legal charges of assault and strangulation but has denied the allegations with team support.

title: Prosecutor who tried Brian Walshe for murder enters Norfolk DA race
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Greg Connor, Norfolk County chief trial counsel, enters the race for district attorney to succeed retiring Michael Morrissey.
Connor, known for prosecuting high-profile cases like Brian Walshe's, offers experience as a key point in his campaign.
The 2026 election includes five Democratic candidates; Connor emphasizes reforming the DA's office with his own vision.
